sections.heading: officer; retirement; records; transfer
sections.text: It shall be the duty of every person retiring from a town office to deliver to his successor in office all the records, books, papers, money, and property belonging to such office held by him.SourceLaws 1895, c. 28, § 43, p. 143;R.S.1913, § 1029;C.S.1922, § 931

23-245.Town officer; retirement; records; transfer.

It shall be the duty of every person retiring from a town office to deliver to his successor in office all the records, books, papers, money, and property belonging to such office held by him.

SourceLaws 1895, c. 28, § 43, p. 143;R.S.1913, § 1029;C.S.1922, § 931;C.S.1929, § 26-245;R.S.1943, § 23-245.

Annotations

Every person retiring from town office is required to deliver the records and property of his office to his successor. Town of Denver v. Myers, 63 Neb. 107, 88 N.W. 191 (1901).
